greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=3, a(1)=1, a(2)=0; thereafter a(n) = a(n-1-a(n-1))+a(n-2-a(n-2)) unless a(n-1) <= n-1 or a(n-2) <= n-2 in which case the sequence terminates.
reference: Higham, Jeff and Tanny, Stephen, A tamely chaotic meta-Fibonacci sequence. Twenty-third Manitoba Conference on Numerical Mathematics and Computing (Winnipeg, MB, 1993). Congr. Numer. 99 (1994), 67-94.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: where xs = map a244483 $ zipWith (-) [1..] $ tail a244483_list
xref: See A006949 for overview of sequences produced by this recurrence and various initial conditions.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 03 2014
